comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Aunty ABC became a 'Commission' in 1932, so this photo must be after that. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australian_Broadcasting_Corporation [busting to know what the band were playing!]

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article17027098 I wonder whether this might have been the ABC Military Band (also known as the National Military Band), which per this SMH item, was formed in ca. November 1933. Per other digitised newspaper hits, I've discovered that the band continued until October 1951, when it was 'disbanded' (!) following funding cuts. If this is the ABC Military Band, then I gather this pic doesn't show their full compliment (maybe the other half were in the bow). With a bit more resolution we might be able to read the score the blokes up the back are playing...looks like they're in open seas...though it's a bit of a mill pond... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article47543310 this Adelaide Advertiser pic shows their uniforms in the 1930s. Some background here - www.abc.net.au/corp/history/75years/timeline/orchestras.pdf An even better photo here - catalogue.slwa.wa.gov.au/search/?searchtype=t&SORT=D&...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Good point, thanks beachcomber and quasymody! Perhaps this event was the broadcast on MS KANIMBLA? nla.gov.au/nla.news-article95930493 Too difficult to say for certain though. Great investigating! EDIT: really wouldn't be MS KANIMBLA now that you look at it, they're on a much smaller vessel.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] That's a good find! If this pic does involve the ABC Military Band and the Kanimbla, maybe this pic was taken on a launch going to or from the Kanimbla...a last minute rehearsal perhaps? I've just discovered there's some fantastic background on the Kanimbla here bpadula.tripod.com/australiashortwave/id63.html

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] ... on the strength of these additional pics [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] will now be able to work out the notes they're playing, and probably the name of the piece as well...watch this space!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Ha ha! There might be an extra clue in these other photos. I have found nothing on this occasion yet, but I did find an interesting 1934 article about "SEA CHANTIES - A Dying Tradition" which may be of interest. It mentions the ABC Military Band as "causing long-dead deep-sea sailormen to wring their spectral hands in despair" ! trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/17070023
